message.content:
I need to identify the line item that represents a decrease in amounts owed to the entity for goods or services sold or provided on credit.

In accounting terms, when customers owe money to a business for goods or services provided on credit, this is recorded as "Accounts Receivable." An increase in accounts receivable means more money is owed to the company, while a decrease means more money has been collected than new credit extended.

Looking at the cash flow statement, I can see the line item "(Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable" with a value of "-3098023.69".

The negative value here indicates an increase in accounts receivable (not a decrease). This means more money is now owed to the entity than before (i.e., the company has sold more goods/services on credit than it has collected payment for).

Since the question asks for a decrease, and we have an increase (negative value), this is still the relevant figure but shows an increase rather than a decrease in amounts owed.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '-3098023.69'}}
```
